website_summaries.verdict: Incredibly durable and ideal for swimming in sunlit conditions, though some owners find them to be too tight-fitting and have trouble seeing through them during indoor or night swimming.
pros: Different sized nose clips included to improve fit
Mirrored lenses are helpful when swimming in bright sunlight
cons: Some users feel the mirrored lenses are too dark and difficult to see through
Reports of its strap splitting or breaking

customer_reviews.title: NOT SPPEDO
customer_reviews.text: These were not Speedo googles. They were counterfeit googles. They were latex and were not supposed to have latex in them. My daughter has a latex allergy and after wearing them briefly her face was red and swollen where the googles were sitting. Took several days, purchasing medicine, and a Doctors visit to get her face back to normal. Cost us over a $100.00 for Dr. visits, etc. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. THEY ARE NOT ACTUAL SPEEDO'S. SPEEDO DOES NOT USE LATEX IN THIS MODEL OF GOOGLES. WE KNOW, BECAUSE THIS IS OUR DAUGHTERS GO TO GOOGLES AND THE GOOGLES HER SWIM TEAM USES.
customer_reviews.author: D&C 50:24

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: If I could give these goggles 0 stars, I would. My daughter is a 6 day a week swimmer and had owned 8 pairs of these over the past 2 years. She loves how they feel in the water, which is why we continud to repurchase. However every pair broke in exactly the same way at the nosepiece. She has gone thru 3 pairs in the past 3 months. I attempted to contact Speedo directly about this potential product design flaw, but their response was disinterested at best. We will be a Tyr family from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: ... of my sons are swimmers and they have been pretty fond of the Speedo Vanquisher 2
customer_reviews.text: Both of my sons are swimmers and they have been pretty fond of the Speedo Vanquisher 2.0 for the past few years (I've probably bought 10 pairs by now) but this last pair broke about 10 minutes into practice. The plastic where the nose piece connects to the goggle just snapped and broke completely leaving them absolutely useless. My son was pretty mad because he had to finish the next 90 minutes with no goggles. I was not able to return them for some reason but after explaining what happened Amazon issued me a full refund. 3 stars for Speedo and 5 stars for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Roger B

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for long swims
customer_reviews.text: Well I normally wear a speed socket model goggle for racing, these goggles are much more padded around the eye socket and are comfortable for longer swims without rubbing your eyes as much. The only compromise there is that they don't adhere to your face quite as well on a entry or start dive. After more than 2,000 hours in the pool, these goggles are still holding up great! Making sure to dry them off and keep him in there and they gobble pouch will further prolong your life as it prevents any dry rotted deterioration of the gasket.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Giles

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the 3 star reviews are about.
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely 5 star quality... Up until 2 years ago, I was a competitive swimmer at a division 3 collegiate level with 16 years of racing under my belt. I have tried most goggles out there like the Swedes and the TYR version but have always made it back to the vanquisher. They are the best for cost, aerodynamics, and feel. For everyone complaining about being too dark, I'm not sure what you're looking for, these are goggles, not corrective lenses. The black line on the bottom of the pool isn't that hard to see. Also, if I had wanted my competition to see my eyes, I would have gotten clear goggles. FYI, no competitive swimmer wears clear goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Amazon not an authorized seller according to Speedo
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these for my grandchildren for competition. First meet, two of them broke by the nose strap area. We are left with 1 unused one. Of course, my poor grandchild (See actual event photo) lost that race. We could not return to Amazon because we sent these goggles internationally hoping to depend on a Speedo brand. Reached out to Speedo hoping for a resolution but said, since Amazon is not an authorized seller, that they cannot do anything. What a waste of time, effort, and money. Horrible experience!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: My daughter swims competitively and is very superstitious - she'll only swim with the Speedo rainbow colored goggles. She had a pair for over a year but they broke in May, so I ordered a new pair, which had a pinhole leak in the rubber gasket. Thinking it was a fluke, I ordered two additional pairs a few weeks later - one to use and one to have as a spare. On the first day, the nosepiece broke. The second pair also had a pinhole leak in the rubber gasket. We've used speedo goggles for years but it recently the the quality seems to be much lower. Unfortunately we will be looking for alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one use
customer_reviews.text: Broke in the nose piece area, just like a lot of other dissatisfied customers. What's really sad is that if they changed the injection mold to include more plastic material in this area (I'm talking about 0.5 to 1.0 mm), then these goggles would be awesome. Why do they make the nose connection point, and the side connection point, so small and thin? They do it on purpose so that it breaks intentionally, forcing you to buy another pair of goggles. Adding just a bit more material would fix the problem and add zero cost. I won't be buying these again. Any recommendations on a HIGHER QUALITY goggle that will last an entire swim season?
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit or....
customer_reviews.text: I have work Vanquishers ~4x/week for the last 3 years. Somebody nabbed my previous pair so I came here to buy another pair. I have several reasons for suspecting that the goggles I received from this amazon seller are counterfeit. 1. The tint is darker than normal 2. The straps are flatter 3. No Speedo logo embossed on the upper left corner of the lenses 4. Thinner eye gaskets 5. The straps are extremely short. Not enough to wrap around an adult head. 6. THEY LEAK! I noticed a small hole in the rubber gasket after my first practice with these goggles. Either this is a fraudulent seller or Speedo's QA/QC department missed a batch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ward

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite speedo goggles yet
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite speedo goggles yet. I read the bad reviews but I think the suction cup part are just defectives. Mine arrives perfectly fine and I've used them many times. I've had no problems with the straps either and love how smooth they are. Makes it nice when you aren't wearing a cap! Doesn't pull your hair. My adivice would be to make the strap loose first , put it on then adjust it. Good quality goggles. Loved the rainbow color. Eye catching
customer_reviews.author: G A Wayadande

customer_reviews.title: No more fog, leaks, and constant adjusting!
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking a swimming class and I needed some goggles. I used a pair made by a well known sneaker company and they worked okay but they leaked, got foggy, and had to be constantly adjusted. I wanted to try something different and I knew something had to be better out there. I checked reviews and they led me to these Speedo Vanquisher 2.0's. What a huge difference! No more adjusting, no more fog, and no more leaks! My only complaint is that they were a little too tight after practicing in the water. I'll adjust them and they should be fine. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: M.Williams

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality you expect from Speedo- could not use not once
customer_reviews.text: First, I would totally return these if the return window hadn't closed. I bought as part of a birthday gift and she received them after the return date (Does not pay to shop early). We have used Speedo vanquishers before and can expect them to get through a season of swimming several times a week. No, not this set. She put them on jumped in the pool and came right back out "these aren't keeping the water out" I took them off and inspected....the rubber that should keep water from entry isn't even attached to the goggles. These googles aren't cheap...but, this set is cheaply made. Super sad.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: ... were excited to receive these goggles - they looked great, but when we removed the plastic lens protectant
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to receive these goggles - they looked great, but when we removed the plastic lens protectant, the mirrored coating came right off. I ordered a second pair and the same thing happened. Still waiting for our return to finish processing : (
customer_reviews.author: Erica W. Lundquist

customer_reviews.title: Nice goggles, but doesn't always stay on
customer_reviews.text: We love the speedo goggles and have bought several of them. Thats what happens when you get them for kids, they tend to be careless and leave them behind at the pool and we lose them. We've bought several now, but I do have to complain that even with multiple adjustments, the goggles keep falling off during her competitions. Not sure why. Other than that, its great when it stays on. It looks very stylish and provides the protection she needs to be her best. Again, this is when it stays on. Still worthy of 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: johnny0723

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite swim goggles
customer_reviews.text: I have managed to collect now four pairs of swimming goggles.This pair is my clear favorites. While I am still satisfied with at least two other pairs, I am reluctant to use them. I've been using these now for about 6 weeks. There is still a fogging issue, but there is a better performance for these Speedo googles and they are comfortable to put on, wear, and take off. I see no reason for me to look for a better goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Edwards_CSG

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste the money on this junk!
customer_reviews.text: These are JUNK. I have three kids on swim team this year and in less than a month two of the three sets have broken in the exact same spot. The part where the nose piece is held in place just snaps off. I am very aggravated that after spending the money on these, at the reccomendation of their coach, that they couldn't even last through a 2 month long season. The only bright side is that I spent about half what I would have at Big 5 for the same junk goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaboo

customer_reviews.title: Great for triathlons!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only one I've found that fits me well, doesn't bruise my eye sockets when I am doing distance swims, and when paired with a little drop of baby smampoo they tend to stay clear and not fog up. At least for a season. I do have to replace them once a year but between pool swims and open water swims I do tend to be pretty hard on them. In my 4 years of triathlons I've been through a number of different brands and styles. And this is by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: E. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: The tried and true..works.
customer_reviews.text: My son is a competitive swimmer who swims every day. So we go through goggles. These remain a favorite for him. Do the straps break? Yeah But when the do, I just change the rubbery straps for the bungee straps and we’re good for a bit longer. Googles break, they get lost. Nature of of the beast. These have remained his favorite practice googles and his back up competition goggles for years. And I don’t see that changing
customer_reviews.author: LiteraryChaos

customer_reviews.title: Not for UV light therapy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ll start this off by saying if I were an avid swimmer, these would be great goggles. Highly recommend them. However, I didn’t buy them for that, I bought them because the goggles I use for UV-B light therapy broke and I needed something to protect my eyes from the UVA/B. I used a UV flashlight to check it’s effectiveness. The front lens (the flat part) does a great job of filtering UV, the edges, however, are only partially effective. For outdoor swimming, this is probably no big deal. For UVB light therapy, not good. I’m thinking of painting the edges black just to block all light except through the lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Water Leak
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these includig my wife and child. I constantly get water in my right eye. I have changed the nose pieces several times, and still no fix. By the way, the nose piece changing is not easy and feels like you will break something by just popping them out/in. My wife doesn't use hers and my child perfers to use other goggles. I have seen that this may not be official Speedo (just not sure), and this would aggravate me that Amazon will allow counterfeit products especially ones with this many purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Animal827

customer_reviews.title: Love These Goggles!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd pair of vanquishers I’ve bought. The first pair were Mirrored and I loaned them to my kiddo when she forgot hers for a meet and they never came back. Second pair were clear for indoor swimming. I keep them at the gym. This pair is also mirrored. I couldn’t handle outdoor swims without them! They do come with different nose piece options to customize, but I like the one that comes installed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great sun protection
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kids swim on team year round. These goggles are good and tend to last awhile. The area that they break at is the plastic on the eye piece where the nose strap fits into the eye piece. It seems to get brittle over time and just snaps. The reflective eye pieces really help cut out the sun glare, especially during back stroke. The rubber band is less comfortable than the bungee style strap, so they tend to swap that out as well. It would be AMAZING if they started making these with those types of straps! All in all, these aren't bad goggles.
customer_reviews.author: J. Law

customer_reviews.title: High school swim team gear
customer_reviews.text: Got these for daily use in High school swim team for my daughter and she’s very happy with them. I thought the silver would be too dark for indoor use but it’s just fine. I see huge rings around her eyes when she removes them but she said it doesn’t hurt or bother her much. She has a lot of experience in different googles and she likes these. I hope they last for her entire freshman year and beyond!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Nikolaev

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, comfortable, reliable, durable, great for beginners and semi-pros
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this for 10 years now. I've tried every other kind of goggles and I like this one. In competitions, I can drive and swim and it doesn't come off. It does scratch easy, but so do other mirrored goggles. That is a minor thing that can be resolved with a $3 case off Amazon. The last one I had, I used it for 2 years and I was in a swimming pool 30 hours a week with it. It also looks good with ANY swimsuit that even has a hint of red in it. If you want to swim faster, get goggles with smaller lenses. This works nice for my big nose, big eyes, and long eyelashes.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer from SLC,UT

customer_reviews.title: Only goggles my son uses
customer_reviews.text: These are the only goggles my son will use. We do not use the straps as we use replacement bungee with push button lock. He swims 6 days a week. Speedo has a one time warranty swap out when they break. At the nose is where they break on us. About every 3 months we have to replace. We buy 2 a year and speedo sends us 2 out for warranty. Always have a second pair in swim bag for when they break. Will always buy Speedo products as they are great and customer service is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews by Dee Cee

customer_reviews.title: Durability isn’t what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: We love those goggles. Somehow the silver mirrored seem to have a manufacturing defect. I bought a pair a year ago, they were perfect, sadly my son lost them, I bought a new pair June 2019, a month later, while adjusting they broke, the left side holding the nose piece cracked. I received a replacement. Now 1 month and 2days later the replacement pair broke exactly in the same spot, left side while we were adjusting them, but we barely used them 3-4 times. It appears to be a recent problem. Aside from durability they are awesome. But durability is a must.....
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Hichem Lamouchi

customer_reviews.title: Simply THE best firm and products.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this firm's products for decades and find them very trustworthy. I buy other stuff but none lasts as long or gives me better satisfaction. This is especially true when it comes to goggles and the fit. I have a large bridged nose and impact to it over the years has been a problem causing leakage. This model and the smallest size nose bridge spacer seems to work best. Snapping in the nosepiece is fairly easy. Snapping it out is not so easy so be ware and be careful. This shipment arrived exactly as predicted.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Best Competitive Goggles
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been a swimmer since he was a kid, and he has always used these goggles. He says they are amazing, as he can see perfectly under water. They stay on and don't bother him at all. His previous pair was super old and needed to be replaced, so I started looking around and sure enough found them on Amazon cheaper. Will purchase again in future once these are done for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: These are great open water swimmers for sure, the mirrored tint works great for being open water during sunny days. I have had times of leakage while swimming and have definitely had fog issues as well, especially for ANTI-FOG goggles. I have found with a little extra TLC and some anti-fog i have about 85/90% solved the fog issue. Not saying I would not buy these again, but it would be a long decision before doing so, with so many other brands and googles out there.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Reeve

customer_reviews.title: Just disappointed that the straps broke before he even used the ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the goggles yesterday. Son used them for swim practice this AM and as he was tightening the straps, they broke. Thankfully we had bungee cord strap on hand so that he could use them right away. Son likes them as he swims in an outdoor pool and there is a lot of sun glare/reflection. Just disappointed that the straps broke before he even used the goggles. Highly recommended but having an extra cord handy or it would be important to include in the packaging as well.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Best Goggles in the Business
customer_reviews.text: I've been swimming competitively forever and I am currently on my third pair of Vanquisher 2 goggles. I've tried a variety of competing products but always end up coming back. They have a great field of view, fit well, and don't leak. After a few years you may have to replace the strap but it's an easy swap. They do fog after a few uses but I'd challenge you to find a pair that doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: MKSchmitt

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 1st day- strap 1st then plastic holding nose piece.
customer_reviews.text: A pair of goggles this expensive should not break on the 1st day and we've had this happen twice! We love the comfort and design but the plastic holding the nose piece breaks very easily and can't be fixed. The strap also snapped on one pair.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these. For real.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy these. I went through two pairs (mainly because I left the first one at the pool). But, both pairs had lots of issues with fogging. No matter what I couldn’t get it to stop. Had to fix it every other lap. Ridiculous. After less than a month of three times per week use on the second pair, they broke. The area that holds the nose bridge on is flimsy plastic and simply broke off. Just stay away from these
customer_reviews.author: skyman

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids that are rough with their equipments
customer_reviews.text: My 8/9 yr old used these for almost 6 months. She swims in swimming club. I bought another speedo design for my 11 yr old and that pair still holding up. This design broken at the nose, after compare to our other speedo goggle. We notice this design, nose bridge is fixed. If you fold the goggle or pull too hard (which younger kids are careless), it will cost nose section to break. while my 11yr old goggle nose bridge has the flexibility that this goggle don't allow.
customer_reviews.author: mjjn2222

customer_reviews.title: Gold standard. Think against the mirror for ocean swimming
customer_reviews.text: After using these in 5 triathlons and practice I am finally writing a review. I think speedo is probably the gold standard for this line of products. The bands have not lost elasticity at all. Given that they look through to have two separate straps behind your head, you have a lot of adjustment to customize their fit. Con: the mirrored lens can be dark in the morning ocean, or any murky water for that matter. Coming out of the water to a sunny glare isn't so hot either. Depending on the time of day and where the sun is when you're spotting, the mirrored lens may not be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Brett on prime

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2015 when I was training to be a life guard. These did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Beware! May cause rash around the eyes!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has meets almost every weekend and has three or four pairs of goggles just in case. Even though we bought these in July, this was her last practice spare. Well, she has been using them for less than a week and she started getting a rash around her eyes and it keeps getting worse. She has every brand out there and has never reacted like this. Until we bought these from amazon. Never have we had such a reaction to a product from amazon but extremely disappointed. AND she has 8th grade pictures on Wednesday!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money on these googles.
customer_reviews.text: You'd think a brand as well know as speedo would do a better job than a flimsy little piece of paper tooting their own "perfection". The googles do come with a bag of nose bridges and a 2 lines paragraph on how to snap a new one in place. But ABSOLUTELY NO direction on how to remove the bridge. A few Youtube videos suggest several dubious approaches all followed by comments from customers who tried them...and broke their new googles. Mine broke too. Threw them away. So sorry I wasted the full price on those.
customer_reviews.author: LeClient

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: The suction is bothersome, but it's powerful. They're standard fit, and the nose bridges don't really change anything about the comfort. It's more up to one's tolerance and getting used to it. I would say they're worth the money, but they could be cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Fog city
customer_reviews.text: Speedo seems to be resting on its laurels here. The Vanquisher costs more than most other goggles and yet is inferior from an anti fog perspective. I’ve been swimming with my new Vanquishers for just a couple weeks and they are already super foggy. I won’t buy these again as I’ve tried cheaper goggles within the past year that made it 3-4 months of regular lap swimming before I saw any fog. If you want a good product from speedo their comp. training suits, specifically the enduro material, are great. Re. the goggles, they need to step up their game or suffer dilution of brand value
customer_reviews.author: A Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great racing goggle but they break way too quickly!
customer_reviews.text: Got these on July 10th, and they broke at the nose piece yesterday, July 14th. Barely lasted a month, and didn't make the whole summer swim season. I asked for a replacement of a previous pair that did the same thing - and Speedo replacement them but with a stern warning that they would only do it once. I seems to me there should be a better warranty on these. Better yet - perhaps Speedo could fix the problem. it's a common complaint with them.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa S.

customer_reviews.title: these are a great pair of goggles
customer_reviews.text: I've been using speedo for my training goggles for a really long time now, but I use arena Cobra's for my meets. Nevertheless, these are a great pair of goggles. This specific color scheme (dark blue), is made for outdoors. They are very dark, which meets outdoor needs great. Compared to the arena training goggles, these hold up much better. I don't see any difference in material compared to like a year ago, since I saw some other reviews out there complaining about it. Pro: -This specific color is great for outdoors -Can take a beating -Doesn't leave raccoon eyes -Fits most eyes comfortably Con: -Too dark for indoor swim season
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Is this authentic?
customer_reviews.text: Update 9/21/2019 - Now "Lewison" is no longer a seller of the product and my order shows it was sold by "Swim_2000", as if they are the same entity...doesn't it look fishy? Original review - Bought a pair of "Deep Gold" sold by Lewison. It came with a pair that had two labels, the one on the top showing it's Deep Gold, the bottom label "Red". And it was red. This doesn't give me confidence that it's authentic.
customer_reviews.author: BYS

customer_reviews.title: Deeper socket clears my eyelids
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed these goggles swimming this summer. I had always used Tyr google in the past but the latest pair I had wasn't deep enough and my eyelids kept hitting the goggle. I don't have the same problem with this product. This is my first pair of goggles that are mirrored. They are much better outside than my previous goggles that were blue tinted. Having used them for a while, I'd like it even more if they were a bit darker.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Fogged in the first week, leak after four
customer_reviews.text: New to swimming, decided to buy a nice set of goggles. After the first week, and taking care of them as stated in the instructions, they started to fog up inside in the first 10 minutes of swimming. At week three they started seeping water in the right eye, now it just constantly drips. I was not aware that goggles are considered expendables. Not happy with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! Like in a video game!
customer_reviews.text: The glasses are great!!! Love them. I don't feel that I wear glasses (they are that comfortable), while freestyle swimming You feel like in a video game 😁 mainly because of panoramic view (side parts) and a little front zoom. No water inside (because of the inner eye concept). Though after about a week of use, the left part started to become froggy, after washing under cold water, it returned to normal for a long period. Minus one star, because there was a small scratch (black point on the photo attached) on of the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Water in my goggles.
customer_reviews.text: I've used them several times in the last month and I've swapped out the nose-pieces that come with it think it might help, but I always end up getting water in the goggles while I swim. Very annoying, I'll get it to fit right where it doesn't, but then after a while I have to keep re-adjusting. UPDATE: Been another month and after swapping out the nose pieces, I ALWAYS get water in my right goggle. No matter what. It's so frustrating. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sarakilpa

customer_reviews.title: We got a defective pair
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. This is the model of goggles my daughter prefers, and we have purchased many in the past, including from this supplier. However, on the very first use this pair broke and became in-usable. On the bright side, Amazon is sending an immediate replacement — we are hopeful this was a one-off defect.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: No fog; secure fit
customer_reviews.text: The lenses don't fog up, whether in warm water or cold water. Furthermore, these goggles with snugly around your eyes without requiring the band to be very tight. These goggles are inexpensive, but the downside is that the strap is very spartan and takes some time to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Joon Lee

customer_reviews.title: high school varsity swim team approved
customer_reviews.text: My teenage daughter is on the high school varsity swim team and this is what she uses for both practices and meets. She has no complaints I would recommend these
customer_reviews.author: catch211

customer_reviews.title: Best goggles we've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: My daughters have tried numerous brands and styles of swim goggles; they usually are quite disappointed. These are the first that have great suction power and don't leak. They don't fog up. They are comfortable. The sun reflection coating is a decided bonus. The upshot: we strongly recommend these goggles.
customer_reviews.author: La Famiglia

customer_reviews.title: Break too easily
customer_reviews.text: My son is a high school swimmer & loves these goggle except for one major problem: they break too easily! And in the same place every time, which the included replacement part doesn't fix. Speedo throws in a couple of nose pieces, but the goggles tend to break where the nosepiece attaches, making it impossible to reattach a new piece. We've been through enough pairs that we're moving on to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Conn

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and brake at the nose bridge
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it! They will hurt your eyes and after about a month of use they broke at the nose bridge. I don't want to waist my time calling Speedo (no email or chat option and Amazon only directs to Speedo). These are absolute junk, made out of very hard plastic that just cracks.
customer_reviews.author: dcart

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY; NOSE PIECE BREAKS
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a competitive swimmer and just received these January 24, 2019. She has not even had them one month, and today they snapped at the nose piece area. We have been purchasing Speedo goggles for years and have never had a problem like this. I thought maybe it was a fluke, but I see reviews show that the problem is ongoing. I am furious!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie P.

customer_reviews.title: Broke Before First Use
customer_reviews.text: Never even got to try them out. I went to change the nose piece and the plastic on the goggles broke. Complete junk. The design is such that you either have to break the goggles or break the nose piece to remove the nose piece. No way to just test one and go back to a different one. I've always had speedo goggles, but never again. Next pair will be TYR.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sprehe

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great value, you look awesome, and they got very well. The post popular Google on my team for good reason. They're very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design
customer_reviews.text: We used to love Speedo Vanquishers. They don’t leak. This summer, my family has had SIX pairs break in the same spot. This was across family members and at different times. They weren’t playing roughly with them or doing anything out of the ordinary. The spot where the nose piece joins the goggles together is a weak point. When it breaks, the goggles can’t be fixed. I’m now searching for another brand. With three competitive swimmers, I need goggles that are going to last.
customer_reviews.author: T.W.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.  Broke after three times using
customer_reviews.text: We bought these goggles and they were delivered March 9th to my home. We went on lockdown for covid on March 13th. My son wore them twice. He returned to the water last week and they broke. So after 3 uses these goggles broke. He is a competitive swimmer and I am shocked at the poor quality of these goggles. The nose bridge broke.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Sleek design and a good fit - rarely deal with any unwanted water intake
customer_reviews.text: The googles are a great fit for me. Suction was good and could almost be too strong if pressed too hard. I rarely have any water enter, if I do, it's due to my lack of spraying the goggles prior and not paying close enough attention to the suction. I'd purchase these again and would definitely recommend them for the sleek design and sun protection.
customer_reviews.author: Yoni K

customer_reviews.title: Defective Design
customer_reviews.text: Broke in second use. There is a design flaw as we have had three pairs break at the nosepiece in less than a week of use. I can’t depend on these for swim team and will be ordering a different brand. My kids love the feel of these, but I cannot recommend. All have broken under typical use (1 hour swim team practice- no horseplay) within the first three times of use. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen.Mike

customer_reviews.title: Band snapped on my first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these goggles when I decided to get back into swimming for exercise. On my first use, as I was tightening the goggles and the band snapped. I was not pulling very hard, so this came as a surprise. I was able to tie the band back together as a quick fix, but had to buy another pair of goggles later.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: They keep snapping!
customer_reviews.text: My kids have been doing competitive swimming for 5 years. We have been using Speedo goggles for 5 years and not had any problems (other than normal wear and tear issues). I have bought two pairs of theses now and both have snapped in the same spot. One after using it 3-5 times and now again after using them approx. 15 times. NOt sure what is going on with them. It is a very thin piece of plastic where it breaks. :-(
customer_reviews.author: cindy gaines

customer_reviews.title: Good open water google.
customer_reviews.text: Tried them swimming in the beach. My visibility underwater was good and for the most part the goggles kept the water out. Sun was out but did not have any problem with sun glare. A small amount came in but possibly I needed to tighten the strap more. The nose piece is a little tricky to remove and replace but I was able to change the nose piece to the smaller size without damage to the goggles. Overall I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, but fragile
customer_reviews.text: I've had these goggles for maybe a week or less. I liked the fog-free feature of these goggles. I also liked the anti-glare that the mirror finish gave. These goggles however, broke very easily at the spot where you change nose pieces. I added a picture of what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.author: radicldreamr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for competitive swimers
customer_reviews.text: 2 of my kids are competitive swimmers. These are the only goggles that fit well and don't leak water in. They have really good suctioned so they dont have to keep pressing the goggles against their faces. The goggles fit well and they can see clearly with them on.
customer_reviews.author: fatimah amara

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Sleek BUT Handle With Care
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these swim goggles. Pros: * They are comfortable and once adjusted stay exactly where you want them. * Mirrored finish / tinting is a huge benefit when swimming outdoors in the summer * UV protection keeps your eyes safe from exposure Cons: * The mirror finish/tinting began to scratch/wear off after a brief period of time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the goggles I was looking for for casual lap swimming
customer_reviews.text: Excellent goggles for casual lap swimming. I have used these goggles about 20 times now over the past two months. Pros * They fit well, and are very comfortable to wear for periods up to 20 minutes without adjustment * They keep water out of your eyes, completely. No leaks were experienced with normal use * They do not obscure your vision while under or out of water * They provide a bit of shade for your eyes * They look cool Cons * Perhaps not as hydrodynamic as racing goggles * Mirrored lenses scratched easily (although this did not seem to affect vision, only aesthetics)
customer_reviews.author: E2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for narrow faces and large nose
customer_reviews.text: I have been through many goggles that, even with adjusting the bridge, still continued to painfully dig into my nose. This particular model fits over the bridge of my nose and still has the actual eye cups comfortable provide suction. Just be careful to mind the care instructions so you don't mistakenly scratch the anti-fog coating.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan L.

customer_reviews.title: Works for my Swimmer
customer_reviews.text: My son joined the swim team & these goggles worked well for the first two weeks...hence my 3-star rating as they broke. His coach had thrown them in the trash instead of giving them back, so we couldn't try to exchange for a new pair. We are giving it another go with a new pair as my son was happy with these goggles.
customer_reviews.author: Yachai

customer_reviews.title: The mirrored feature is great, which I didn't realize was a good thing ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to get back into swimming and look stylish while doing it. The mirrored feature is great, which I didn't realize was a good thing until my wife specifically requested mirrored goggles. I ended up purchasing a pink pair for her. Ages ago I was a competitive swimmer and Speedo googles were the only ones I used. The googles last a very long time, but the anti-fog feature lasts longer than any other brand on the market so far. No goggles have the anti-fog feature forever though. These are affordable and great value, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: iamcloud

customer_reviews.title: Poor production standards
customer_reviews.text: We buy these a lot because my daughter is a swimmer, and she's allergic to other brands. Gets a two-star rating because several of them were defective and we had to send back; the straps often break early when tightening; and we've had problems with cracking or warping where the nose piece inserts. If we could find an option that didn't turn our daughter's face into a massive allergic reaction, we'd change in a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These really are the best goggles I’ve ever used, and I’ve been swimming for over 20 years. My son uses them for swim team and I use them for swimming laps and they are great for both of us. Highly recommend this product. We have multiple pairs in different colors and the quality is the same for all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Read first.
customer_reviews.text: My issue is, it doesn't provide the best of seals around the eyes. Water leaks in all the time. No matter what I do, If I try having them hold on to my face then strap on, it doesn't work. If I try strapping them on then pressing them in, still doesn't work. One good thing, the antifogging does actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and don’t leak!!
customer_reviews.text: These SPEEDO VANQUISHER 2.0 goggles are my favorite! I swim 25 hours a week and need to be focused on my mechanics, not leaking or uncomfortable goggles. These are comfortable and don’t leak. Five stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I find that it's hit or miss as to whether or not goggles are blurry or clear once you get under the water. These goggles are crystal clear, and you don't have to wear too tightly in order to get a comfortable fit without any leakage. Ordered a few more pair after trying the initial purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Speedo is Speedo
customer_reviews.text: I am a regular swimmer so i can tell the difference with my old googles. I’m really happy with them. The suction is good! They are super clear. Water don’t filter either. Happy with the purchase! Speedo never disappoints!
customer_reviews.author: lorena

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of goggles.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing is that I have red marks around my eyes when I’m done using these. however, I have bought Michael Phelps brand goggles and many more since. All leave red marks. These are most comfortable around my nose and suction well. My eyes do not hurt from the sun, either. I wear these 3-4 days a week. Very easy to clean and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these, one in this color and the other in black for my son in the high school swim team. This one was used first and long gone now after the nose bridge broke at the hinge that is attached to the goggle itself. So even though they included extra bridges, can't replace because there is nothing to attach to on one side. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke in same spot other reviewers have described
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there is a common flaw with these that causes them to break right where the nose piece attaches. I’ve owned them just over one year and have used them weekly. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great goggles. Only thing is it makes it really hard to see underwater if you get a tinted pair. Other than that I Love em. Use em almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wann

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, work well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for simply doing laps in my pool, nothing too crazy. So far, the goggles have been satisfactory. They fit well on my (large) head, and keep the water out of my eyes. They feel solidly made; mostly rubber with some plastic parts. My only two complaints are minor: 1. I feel as if they fog up a bit too easily. 2. Sometimes the opaqueness of the lens is a bit too much; makes it hard to see in any even remotely low-light situations (swimming at dusk for example). Overall, these goggles seem like a good product. I'd recommend them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Forschberr

customer_reviews.title: Love these goggles!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these goggles all over the world in every kind of water for the last four years. The strap finally broke and I had to buy a second pair for $9...What a deal! I bought the Costco Pack and returned them because these are such better quality, comfort and visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these goggles. Perfect fit water doesn’t come in and no fogging
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the look of these goggles
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of these goggles. However, they do not seem to be responsive to my anti-fog. I spray and I will still fog up. In addition, about halfway through my swim the suction because uncomfortable. If you are not a long distance swimmer these would be great. If you are doing a long distance swim or race I would not recommend them. I'm not sure what it is about the suction that changes but the pressure becomes so great around my eyes I have to stop. In addition at the end of my swim the "raccoon eyes" are horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Great goggle for serious swimmers
customer_reviews.text: I have used Speedo goggles for years. I love them. My only concern with these is that I swim in open water at 6:30 a.m. During the summer the sun is up and a little tint is fine. I don’t think I’ll be able to use these in the fall. However the goggles are perfect, fit nicely and look badass on!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy H.

customer_reviews.title: Fog like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I swam competitively for many years and I previously used the regular vanquisher goggles and they worked like a dream. The Vanquisher 2.0 goggles, however, are another story. Although they do enable you to see more, they fog like crazy. I purchased anti-fog to help with this issue and had to apply it 2 to 3 times during a 1 hr practice just so I could see. I also tried the "toothpaste treatment" which helped with my dive mask but it did absolutely nothing on these goggles. I've never had this problem in all my years of swimming. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B

customer_reviews.title: Not anti fog and tacky rubber
customer_reviews.text: These goggles say anti fog but are definitely not. They started fogging almost immediately. The rubber around the eye pieces feels tacky almost like they are old. I would not waste money on these. Only kept them because we left for vacation the same day we received them .
customer_reviews.author: Mama5b

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and potential known issue
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these same goggles twice. Both times they broke in the same spot. I thought the first time was due to my daughter mishandling them. So I purchased a second pair and happen again about a month after use. My daughter has been competitive swimmer for years and never had this problem. I've read other reviews and several people had same issue. I wish I would have read them before purchasing. Now I can't get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K.

customer_reviews.title: Ironman glasses
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying my nose is pretty big, and also very crooked (long story). But these work really well and we’re perfect for my Ironman’s when we take off in the morning. I tired a few of the nose pieces but they still hurt after an hr+ workouts. But that’s prob on me.
customer_reviews.author: ABrowak

customer_reviews.title: Only goggles i buy
customer_reviews.text: BEST GOGGLES! I swim all of the time for work and these are my absolute favorite goggles. They have an amazing tint and and very slim and don’t fog up easily.
customer_reviews.author: diane hickman

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough, good buy for price
customer_reviews.text: Received these yesterday - lightening fast shipping from seller. Good pair for amazon price. I typically swim 60-70 mins 4-5 times a week - so i go through a good amount of goggles. Regarding product - comfortable enough, but not quite the most comfortable pair i use. Pretty good buy if you're looking for good comfortable traditional type goggles. I will probably keep a pair in my gym bag when i want to give my normal rotation goggles a break. Haven't used them long enough (only 1 day of swimming) to comment on effect of fog-proof - but they appear decent enough from what i can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles
customer_reviews.text: I have used these goggles for years and I love them. Great sun protection—you feel like you’re wearing sunglasses underwater, but you can still see quite clearly. They don’t fog up super fast, either. Easy to adjust and clean. For inexpensive but effective goggles, these work great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stern

customer_reviews.title: 2 pairs broken!!
customer_reviews.text: My son loved these goggles for swim team! He wore the first pair 3-4 times and the piece that holds the nose guard cracked. He had to borrow goggles for the swim meet. I hurried and purchased a second pair and they arrived today, just in time for another swim meet. He got them all fit to size, got to the meet and went to pull them on and the second pair broke in the exact same place! So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Klewis

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I use the non-mirrored for the pool, so I knew what to expect as far as fit, seal, and fogging. The mirrored works great for my open water swims where I am looking up at the sun during breaths.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Geraths

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good. Except it is little bit smaller than I thought. Quality is good. Have a good suction power. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: BigHSML

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for long swims
customer_reviews.text: Well I normally wear a speed socket model goggle for racing, these goggles are much more padded around the eye socket and are comfortable for longer swims without rubbing your eyes as much. The only compromise there is that they don't adhere to your face quite as well on a entry or start dive. After more than 2,000 hours in the pool, these goggles are still holding up great! Making sure to dry them off and keep him in there and they gobble pouch will further prolong your life as it prevents any dry rotted deterioration of the gasket.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Dutt

customer_reviews.title: ... positive for these goggles is that they are really comfortable. Also
customer_reviews.text: The main positive for these goggles is that they are really comfortable. Also, they very rarely leak once they are adjusted correctly. The lense size is generic enought that I think they should fit most people. The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is that they fog easily and the peripheral vision is terrible. As soon as the shade hits my outdoor pool, they are too dark, and it can be hard to see the wall of the pool. These are comfortable goggles and good for general use, but I don't think they would suffice for serious lap swimming. I like the Aqua Socket or Speed Socket for swimming laps.
customer_reviews.author: DrDave18

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best goggles I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best goggles I've ever had. It comes with several sizes for the nose piece, so it can be adjusted to fit anyone. The goggles barely have to be pressed on the face and they form a perfect seal. If you need goggles, you can stop shopping around and go ahead with these. You will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W

customer_reviews.title: Great goggles for a first time goggle wearer
customer_reviews.text: My first set of goggles. I won't swim without goggles anymore. I started going to the gym and the chlorine would burn my eyes so bad, so I finally did tons of research and people recommended the speedo vanquishers. I bought them and fell in love. You people who say it fogs up etc, you can't expect a chemical to last. I took the advice around here and others online and spit on them and they work fine. Only wish the 2.0 came in clear so I can use it at night.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Neckbeard

customer_reviews.title: NOT Anti Fog
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I continue to buy these goggles! First race, both of my girls in State Champ meet.....FOG! Nothing works...believe me, we've tried everything on all goggles. There is no such thing as "anti fog". We've been doing this swim thing for over 12 years....come up with a product that is actually anti fog! At least for one meet anyway...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Speedo Unisex-Adult Swim Goggles Mirrored Vanquisher 2.0
feature_bullets: Anti-Fog: Lenses resist fogging for clear underwater vision
UV Protection: Protects your eyes from the sun's harmful UVA and UVB rays
Mirrored Lens: Maximum visibility, minimum glare; ideal for outdoor use
Maximum visibility, minimum glare; ideal for outdoor use
Wide panoramic lens for extended view

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
